content: tiny treasure sweater 4ply designed by sarah hatton general information it is essential to work to the stated gauge to ensure success and you should always start by knitting a gauge square before knitting the full garment if you have too many stitches to stated gauge your gauge is too tight and you should change to a larger needle if there are too few stitches your gauge is too loose and you should change to a smaller needle please check individual patterns for gauge before starting the garment instructions given are for the 1st size with larger sizes in brackets where only one figure or instruction is given this applies to all sizes work all directions inside brackets to the number of times stated abbreviations alt alternate p purl beg beginning patt pattern cm centimetres pm place marker cont continue psso pass slipped stitch over decrease decrease ing repeat repeat foll following rem remain ing g st garter stitch rh right hand g grammes rs right side in inch es st s stitch es increase increase ing st st stocking stitch k knit sm slip marker kfb knit into front and back sl1 slip one stitch knitways lh left hand decrease together meas measures tbl through back of loops m1 p pick up loop between last ws wrong side and next st and work into the wyif with yarn in front back of this loop yfrn yarn forward and round needle yo yarn forward and over needle sizing * the sizing chart is given as a guide only to fit chest approximately cm 32 42 48 51 52 55 56 age 4lbs premature 7lbs newborn 0-3mo 3-6mo 6-9mo 9-12mo 12-18mo *west yorkshire spinners cannot be held liable for any garments not fitting correctly mo = months tiny treasure sweater measurements gauge 28 sts and 36 row to 10cm measured over st st on to fit larger needles or size needed to achieve stated gauge size 7lbs 0-3mo 3-6mo 6-9mo 9-12mo 12-18mo very important -
